content.description:
Hands start on the single purple hold, feet start on two big holds down below.  Follow the red handholds to topout.

 Good climb for beginner climbers to learn basic body positioning.
content.location:
Walk towards the private property area, in between the rocks it is on the inside, as if you were to scramble to look at the sunset.

If this is sorted into the wrong spot or area, let me know!  I am very willing to move it as needed!

content.description: under the sugar cube... right side start crossed on a sloper just under the right most jugs... throw for a flat crimper then throw for the jug... topout same as sugar cube..
large face just down hill of resin run just above the river boulder... left side, highball above slab...
traverse left from sand castles, throw high for a drop in pocket and work the slopers for grim topout.
start under roof and out the lip on bucks then up-up-and away.
content.protection: if your nimble, you do not even need a pad.
content.location: There is a Hunters database that exists . . . you should get a hold of that.

content.description:
Hands start at top of purple marks, feet on the bottom purple.  All hand holds are marked in red, and you should be able to see chalk on the route.  Finish holds are at the top of the black line.  

Avoid using the ledge on the right for feet, and use the holes in the rock instead.  BUT for new climbers, the ledge may feel comforting, and doesn't take away from the couple of sharp crimps.  The FA was done NOT using the ledge, but I find it totally acceptable to use for new climbers.
content.protection: 1-2 pads.  If only 1, protect under the finish holds, as one foothold did give out on me already.
content.location:
Pass the cave at the main area and head downhill.  Carry on down until you see the larger formation blocking you off from private property.  Make a right and another right.  You will see the black line on the second formation from there.  Will get coordinates next time I am here.

Location on the main map here is somewhere on the back ridge of fortress, feel free to ask me to move this to a more appropriate area if needed.

content.description: down hill from the mojo... start under the uphill side of large boulder that forms the cave... traverse out the overhang and up the far side of the boulder...

Start low on the ground on the right side of the steep over hanging cave. Traverse to up and left towards the center of the over hand, make a big right hand move to a crip rail. Cross left to a shark tooth. God speed on the top out. Make sure it's clean up there.
content.protection: A ton of pads if you don't plan on sending.
content.location: Past mojo in the same cave as teraplata and resin run.

content.description: down with sand castles sit or stand start off the platform... stand starts on a couple pockets... to another pocket for the right... reach high for the flat ledge... highball topout..
A route submitted here is on private property. I'm moving it to this area for posterity, but please do not climb there for as long as access is denied by the property owner.
